page.title: 11ON SHORE OIL IN LINCOLNSHIRE
page.content:
In the summer of 1985 the landscape of the area near Reasby was transformed by the erection of an oil drilling rig. Oil workers, more used to working in the North Sea or the Gulf, found themselves temporarily in the Lincolnshire countryside.
Directional drilling was employed and three holes were drilled to a depth of 1700m. and a distance of 500m. from the wellhead. After removal of the rig, a nodding donkey and storage tanks were installed. The extraction process will be fully automatic. It is hoped that 700 barrels of oil a day will be produced for the next twenty years. The oil will be removed by tanker to a nearby storage depot from where it will go by train to South Wales for processing.
